page.title: 18My Granf's Day 1985
page.content: The day begins when my Granf wakes up and has breakfast, then he goes outside and lets out the three cats and Gypsy the dog and he goes and lets out the chickens and he feeds them. After that he milks and feeds the two goats and with the milk from the goats, at 11 o'clock he makes himself and Gran and Uncle Pete, who works there, a cup of tea or coffee. When that is done he goes and collects the eggs from the hens. He takes them in and washes them for when he sells them. Then he goes in and has his dinner and watches the 1 o'clock News. After his dinner he goes out and sits in the deck-chair and lets his dinner go down. The paper man arrives and he goes and collects the paper and sits down and reads it and then he goes and talks to his next-door-neighbour from the chicken houses.
